item.description:
Join us this month, in conjunction with DWC Boston, for a special author event with Maria Murnane on how to find and follow your passion in life. Maria Murnane is the author of the award-winning romantic comedy, Perfect on Paper: the (Mis)adventures of Waverly Bryson.

Enjoy an evening at the wonderful Sonsie restaurant on Newbury Street as Maria talks about her career change from a 10 year climb in the corporate world in Silicon Valley to discovering that there was more to life than being miserable in her job. How did she cut through the fear to follow her passion? Maria will discuss her personal struggles of identifying her passion and breaking through her fear with her humorous adventures and lessons learned.

She will also discuss how she became a successful, published, author. Sometimes the greatest inspiration can come from a person who has already faced those road blocks and fears that prevent us from taking that one step forward toward our calling. Maria will inspire us and remind us that life is too short to spend it doing something that doesn't make you happy; if you need a change, it’s up to you to make it happen and in the end ... no one is keeping score of your life but you!

 The price for this event is $20, and you must pay in advance. Attendees will enjoy appetizers at Sonsie and will also receive a signed copy of Maria's book! DWC Boston and Cambridge chapters have only 25 spots each for this event, so please make sure that you can attend before you RSVP!

 

 About the Downtown Women's Club:

The Downtown Women's Club is a business network and career website that makes professional networking affordable, effective, and fun! Premium members receive free e-books, teleclasses, member profiles and much more. Visit the DWC website and join today. 

About Sonsie:

Sonsie celebrates seventeen years on Boston’s famous Newbury Street serving top-notch International cuisine from award-winning Chef Bill Poirier. Open seven days a week from 7:00am to 1:00am, Sonsie boasts beautiful French doors that translate to an open sidewalk cafe in season, as well as a European lounge with deep leather chairs and sofas. The mahogany bar serves the best martinis in town from an experienced lot of friendly bartenders and the brick-oven churns out eclectic pizzas and focaccia throughout the day. It is easy to relax at Sonsie and enjoy the classic music that reflects the ambiance of the restaurant as day progresses into night.
item.how_to_find_us: Sonsie has reserved a room for us
item.why: Join us with Maria Murnane as she discusses "Finding and Following your Passion!" Enjoy appetizers, networking, and a signed copy of Maria's book.

group.name: New England Network for Women :: Cambridge

item.name: "Finding and Following Your Passion" with Author Maria Murnane at Sonsie
